gov.usgs.anss.cd11

Class CD11Frame

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.cd11.CD11Frame

  • public class CD11Frame
extends java.lang.Object
    This class does I/O and encodeing and decodeing of CD1.1 frames. It was implented using version 0.3 of the document dated 18 Dec 2002. References in here should be to that document. It can be use to load data for specific frame formats for output, but is mostly used for decoding incoming frames.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CD11Frame

        public CD11Frame(int maxBody,
                 int maxAuthBody,
                 EdgeThread parent)
        This create a frame suitable for reading data
        Parameters:
        maxBody - The maximum body size that can be read into this frame
        maxAuthBody - The maximum authorization size that can be read

      • CD11Frame

        public CD11Frame(int maxBody,
                 int maxAuthBody,
                 java.lang.StringBuilder ocreator,
                 java.lang.StringBuilder odestination,
                 long initSeq,
                 int oseries,
                 int auth,
                 EdgeThread parent)
        creat a CD11 frame designed for output, sets the creator, destination, sequence etc.
        Parameters:
        maxBody - Largest body supported by this frame
        maxAuthBody - The max size of the authorization section of the body
        ocreator - The value of the creator
        odestination - The value of the destination
        initSeq - The initial sequence number
        oseries - The output series number
        auth - The authID to use

      • stringBuilderFrom

        public static java.lang.StringBuilder stringBuilderFrom(byte[] buf,
                                                        int len,
                                                        java.lang.StringBuilder tmp)
        CD1.1 uses null padded strings, but Java wants space padded for convenience. This routine will return a line from a byte array with zeros/null turned to spaces
        Parameters:
        buf - Buffer with data to convert to a string
        len - Desired sring length
        tmp - A string builder which will receive the String or null if one is suppose to be returned.
        Returns:
        A string with spaces replacing the nulls

      • getOutputBytes

        public int getOutputBytes(java.nio.ByteBuffer bbout)
        return via the ByteBuffer given, a buffer of the last type loaded, this is the right routine for output frames
        Parameters:
        bbout - A byte buffer to use in building up the data, must be long enough for header, payload and trailer
        Returns:
        The number of bytes containing valid buffer data

      • getFrameBytes

        public byte[] getFrameBytes()
        I am not sure this routine is needed. It seem to duplicate getOutputBytes() but using the input arguments
        Returns:
        The bytes from the frame using the input data

      • readFully

        public int readFully(java.io.InputStream in,
                     byte[] buf,
                     int off,
                     int len)
              throws java.io.IOException
        read fully the number of bytes, or throw exception
        Parameters:
        in - The InputStream to read from
        buf - The byte buffer to receive the data
        off - The offset into the buffer to start the read
        len - Then desired # of bytes
        Returns:
        The length of the read in bytes, zero if EOF is reached
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if one is encountered reading from the InputStream

      • readFully

        public int readFully(java.io.InputStream in,
                     byte[] buf,
                     int off,
                     int len,
                     EdgeThread par)
              throws java.io.IOException
        read fully the number of bytes, or throw exception
        Parameters:
        in - The InputStream to read from
        buf - The byte buffer to receive the data
        off - The offset into the buffer to start the read
        len - Then desired # of bytes
        par - A edgethread to use for logging
        Returns:
        The length of the read in bytes, zero if EOF is reached
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if one is encountered reading from the InputStream

      • writeFrameForConnect

        public int writeFrameForConnect(java.io.OutputStream out)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        for forwarding we need to recreate the bytes read from the connection frame
        Parameters:
        out - OutputStream to send byts
        Returns:
        Length of outputed frame
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If one is thrown

      • readFrame

        public int readFrame(java.io.InputStream in,
                     EdgeThread par)
              throws java.io.IOException
        this reads in a full frame from an InputStream and loads it into this input frame
        Parameters:
        in - The InputStream to read from
        par - A parent which might get some log I/O
        Returns:
        The number of bytes in the body (payload) of this frame (no headers or trailers), or minus the length if the CRC is bad
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getChannel

        public ChannelSubframe getChannel(int n)
        return the nth (starting with zero) channel subframe in this data frame. This returns an internal scratch channel subframe so beware saving the result in a handle and calling this routine again.
        Parameters:
        n - which frame to get starting with 0 and < DataNChan
        Returns:
        The decoded channel subframe or null if n is out-of-range

      • loadConnectionRequest

        public void loadConnectionRequest(java.lang.String station,
                                  java.lang.String type,
                                  java.lang.String ip,
                                  int port)
                           throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        load this output frame with the information for a connection request
        Parameters:
        station - the SSSSSCCCLL station name
        type - Not used, it is always TCP
        ip - The IP address of this node (the requestor)
        port - The port of the requestor
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException

      • loadOptionRequest

        public void loadOptionRequest(java.lang.String station)
                       throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        load this output frame with the information for a connection request
        Parameters:
        station - the SSSSSCCCLL station name
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException

      • loadConnectionResponse

        public void loadConnectionResponse(java.lang.String station,
                                   java.net.InetAddress ipadr,
                                   int port)
        load this packet with correct information for a connection response. Note the responder will always be USGS and type TCP
        Parameters:
        station - The station identifier used (from the connection request normally)
        ipadr - The IP address the receiver should open for the data connection
        port - The port for the data connection

      • toCDTimeString

        public static java.lang.StringBuilder toCDTimeString(java.util.GregorianCalendar g,
                                                     java.lang.StringBuilder toCD)
        convert a GregorianCalendar to CD1.1 time format YYYYDDD HH:MM:SS.MMM
        Parameters:
        g - A Gregorian time to transform
        Returns:
        The 20 character CD1.1 string

      • fromCDTimeString

        public static void fromCDTimeString(java.lang.String s,
                                    java.util.GregorianCalendar g,
                                    java.lang.Object caller)
        given a 20 byte CD1.1 time string, convert it to a gregorian calendar
        Parameters:
        s - The 20 byte CD1.1 time string yyyyddd_hh:mm:ss.mmm
        g - A gregorianCalendar to set to the time from s

      • loadOptionResponse

        public void loadOptionResponse(byte[] bf,
                               int len)
        load the option request response frame, body is specified as a series of bytes
        Parameters:
        bf - The byte buffer with the body
        len - The length of the buffer in bytes

      • loadAlert

        public void loadAlert(java.lang.String msg)
        load the alert frame,sent just before closing a socket,
        Parameters:
        msg - The alert message

      • loadDataFrame

        public void loadDataFrame(java.util.GregorianCalendar nominal,
                          int frameMS)
        set this frame to be an empty data frame
        Parameters:
        nominal - The Nominal time of the frame as a GC
        frameMS - The time span represented by this frame im milliseconds

      • loadAckNak

        public void loadAckNak(long lowestSeq,
                       long highestSeq,
                       int gapLength,
                       byte[] gapbuf)
        Load an ack nac packet
        Parameters:
        lowestSeq - The lowest sequence (inclusive) being acknowleged
        highestSeq - The highest sequence (inclusive) being acknowleg
        gapLength - The length of the gapbuf in bytes
        gapbuf - Buffer with the encoded gaps per the CD1.1 protocol manual
